snippet: Looking to shift the conversation from obesity, lobbyists are hoping to frame Mayor Bloomberg’s proposed restrictions on sugary beverages as an attack on personal choice.
abstract: Lobbyists from Coca-Cola and other big soda companies are hoping to frame New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg’s proposed restrictions on sugary beverages as an attack on personal choice, shifting the conversation from the city's focus on obesity; the industry has created a coalition called New Yorkers for Beverage Choices to coordinate its public relations efforts in the city.
lead_paragraph: Looking to shift the conversation from obesity, lobbyists are hoping to frame Mayor Bloomberg’s proposed restrictions on sugary beverages as an attack on personal choice.

headline.seo: Fighting N.Y.C. Soda Ban, Industry Focuses on Personal Choice
headline.main: Soda Makers Begin Their Push Against New York Ban
headline.print_headline: Fighting Soda Rule, Industry Focuses on Personal Choice
